lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project eva.storage, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
* Represents the main class of the Eva program. Contains the main method to run the program.
* The Eva program is a task manager that allows users to add, delete, mark as done, and list tasks.

*

The Eva program is able to handle three types of tasks:

*
  • Todo: A task without any date/time attached to it.

*
  • Deadline: A task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.

*
  • Event: A task that starts at a specific time and ends at a specific time.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList  = new ArrayList<>();
* Constructor for the Eva class. Initializes the Ui and Handler objects.
* Runs the Eva program. Loads tasks from the hard drive, handles user input, and saves tasks to the hard drive.
* @throws TaskException If there is an error loading tasks from the hard drive.
* Main method to run the Eva program.
* @throws TaskException If there is an error loading tasks from the hard drive.
public static void main(String[] args) throws TaskException {
* Represents an exception that occurs when handling tasks.
* Constructs a TaskException with the specified detail message.
* Returns a string representation of the TaskException.
* @return A string representation of the TaskException.
* Handles the loading and saving of tasks from the hard drive.
* Loads tasks from the hard drive, which is stored in a text file.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the hard drive.
System.out.println("Task format incorrect! Please refresh/check hard drive for errors");
* Saves tasks to the hard drive, which is stored in a text file.
* @param tasks The ArrayList of tasks to be saved to the hard drive.
System.out.println("IO Error while getting messages: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a task with a deadline. Extends the Task class.
* A Deadline object has a name, a status of whether it is done and a deadline.
* Creates a new Deadline object with the specified name and deadline.
* Creates a new Deadline object with the specified name, status and deadline.
public Deadline(String name, boolean isDone, LocalDate endTime) {
* Returns the string representation of the deadline.
* Returns the deadline of the Deadline object.
* Factory method to create a new Deadline object based on the task description.
* @param taskDesc task description of the deadline
* @throws TaskException if the task description is in an invalid format
public static Deadline createDeadline(String taskDesc) throws TaskException {
* Represents an Event object. An Event has a name, a start time and an end time.
* This class extends from the Task class.
* Creates an Event object with the specified name, start time and end time.
* @param startTime start time of the event.
* @param endTime end time of the event.
private Event(String name, LocalDate startTime, LocalDate endTime) {
* Creates an Event object with the specified name, status, start time and end time.
* @param startTime start time of the event.
* @param endTime end time of the event.
public Event(String name, boolean isDone, LocalDate startTime, LocalDate endTime) {
* Returns the start time of the event.
* Returns the end time of the event.
* Returns the string representation of the event.
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), fStart, fEnd);
* Factory method to create a new Event object based on the task description.
* @throws TaskException if the task description is in an invalid format.
public static Event createEvent(String taskDesc) throws TaskException {
* Represents a Task object. A Task has a name and a status of whether it is done.
* This is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated directly, use of its subclasses is recommended.
* Returns the status of the task.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns the name of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* Factory method to create a task based on the task description.
* @throws TaskException if the task description is invalid.
public static Task createTask(String taskDesc) throws TaskException {
* Loads a task from a string representation, from the hard drive.
* @param taskDesc string representation of the task.
* @throws TaskException if the task description is invalid.
public static Task loadTask(String taskDesc) throws TaskException {
return new Event(taskName, isDone, startTime, endTime);
* Represents a Todo object. A Todo has a name.
* This class extends from the Task class.
* Creates a new Todo object with the specified name.
* Creates a new Todo object with the specified name and status.
* Returns the string representation of the todo.
* Factory method to create a new Todo object based on the task description.
* @throws TaskException if the description of the todo is empty
public static Todo createTodo(String taskDesc) throws TaskException {
throw new TaskException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Represents the user interface of the program. Handles user input and prints messages to the user.
private final String INTRO = "Hello! I'm Eva. \nWhat can I do for you? \n";
private final String END = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Prints the default Eva welcome message.
* Prints the default Eva goodbye message.
* Handles the user input and performs the necessary actions. Actions include adding tasks, marking tasks,
* deleting tasks, listing tasks and exiting the program.
* @param scanner the scanner object to read user input.
* @param taskList the list of tasks to be updated.
* @throws TaskException if the task description is invalid.
public void handleInput(Scanner scanner, ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws TaskException {
* Prints the list of tasks in the task list, if it is not empty.
* If the task list is empty, prints a message to inform the user.
System.out.println("You have no tasks in your list!");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks the task as done or undone based on the task description.
* @param isDone true if the task is to be marked as done, false otherwise.
private void markTask(String taskDesc, boolean isDone) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + this.taskList.get(posToChange).toString());
System.out.println("Ok! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + this.taskList.get(posToChange).toString());
* Creates a task  based on the task description and adds it to the task list.
* @throws TaskException if the task description is invalid.

System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", this.taskList.size()));
* Deletes a task from the task list based on the task description.
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + task.toString());
System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", this.taskList.size()));
